SEARCH
Package grafiosch.usertask

Class LimitCudChange

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.usertask.LimitCudChange
public class LimitCudChange extends Object
Model class representing a request to modify CUD (Create, Update, Delete) operation limits for a specific entity type. This class is used when users with limited privileges request an increase in their daily operation allowances for particular entity types. Users with restricted roles may have daily limits on how many CUD operations they can perform on different entity types. When they need to exceed these limits, they can submit a proposal using this model class, which administrators can review and approve.
The class enforces validation constraints to ensure reasonable limit requests:
- Entity names must be between 1-40 characters
- Day limits must be between 1-99 operations
- All fields are required (not null)

  • Field Details

    • entity

      @NotNull @Size(min=1, max=40) public @NotNull @Size(min=1,max=40) String entity
      The name of the entity type for which the limit change is requested. This identifies the specific data type or table that the user needs increased CUD operation privileges for. Must be between 1-40 characters.

    • untilDate

      @NotNull public @NotNull LocalDate untilDate
      The expiration date for the requested limit change. This date determines how long the increased limit should remain in effect before reverting to the default restrictions. Administrators typically set this to provide temporary increased access for specific time periods.

    • dayLimit

      @NotNull @Min(1L) @Max(99L) public @NotNull @Min(1L) @Max(99L) Integer dayLimit
      The requested daily limit for CUD operations. This represents the maximum number of create, update, and delete operations the user wants to perform per day for the specified entity type. Must be between 1 and 99 operations per day to ensure reasonable usage.
